ObservationService

public ObservationService()
Method Detail

insertObservation

@Transactional
public void insertObservation(ObservationWithData observation)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
Inserts the observation into the database, including all ElementValues (facts and flags). Updates the observation with the timestamp of the load time. Inserts an entry into the ob_loadlog table. Calculated values may be included with the observation or added later. There must not be an observation in the database for the station/datetime already. Expects that no observation for this station/datetime is currently in the database. Throws a SQLException if the observation already exists in the database.

Parameters:
observation - the observation to insert
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if observation not unique or if some other database exception is thrown

                           throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns an Observation for a station for a single datetime

Parameters:
datetimeId - The time of observation
stationId - The station

deleteObservation

@Transactional
public int deleteObservation(int datetimeId,
                                           int stationId)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
Deletes an observation from the database, including all facts, flags, and obloadlogs.

Parameters:
datetimeId - the datetime of the observation to be deleted
stationId - the id of the station whose observation will be deleted
Returns:
the number of observations deleted (always 0 if ob not in database, 1 if it was deleted)
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

getObservations

public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Observation> getObservations(int startDatetimeId,
                                                                    int endDatetimeId,
                                                                    int stationId)
                                                             throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns a Map mapped by datetimeId for a datetime range for a single stations; maps stationId to Observation. The implementation class may throttle the amount of data available for retrieval.

Parameters:
startDatetimeId - The beginning observation time
endDatetimeId - The end observation time
Returns:
A Map for the datetime range for this station
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
